text: Woni (; autonym: ') is a Southern Loloish language spoken in Zhenyuan Yi, Hani and Lahu Autonomous County and Xinping Yi and Dai Autonomous County of Yunnan, China. The most extensive description of Woni to date is that of Yang (2016).Yang Yan [杨艳]. 2016. Haniyu Wonihua yanjiu [哈尼语窝尼话研究]. Ph.D. dissertation, Shanghai Normal University. There are 5,406 speakers of Woni in south-central Yunnan, China. Yang (2016) covers the Woni dialect of Leda village 勒达村, Xinping County. Gao (1955)Gao Huanian [高华年]. 1955. A study of Yangwu Hani [揚武哈尼語初探]. Journal of Sun Yatsen University (Social Science Journal) [中山大学学报:社会科学]. 1955, Vol. 2. covers the dialect of Yangwu Town 扬武镇, Xinping County. ==Classification== Yang (2016) classifies Woni as a
